author: Staff Reporter
text:
Marking the World Cancer Day beyond rallies and sloganeering, a special medical camp for cancer screening was held jointly under the aegis of the Indian Medical Association, Hosur Government Hospital, and municipality here on Thursday.

The camp was conducted for the screening of oral, cervical, lung, breast, and colorectal cancers.

Of the 600 screened, 15 were recommended for second level confirmatory tests for cancer.

Hosur Sub Collector Senthil Raj told The Hindu that orders were given to pay the monthly assistance of Rs. 1,000 for terminally ill cancer patients on the occasion.

He said that a task force consisting of doctors, and social workers, could be formed trace terminally ill cancer patients in Hosur.

“Often terminally ill patients move to Bengaluru or Chennai for palliative care. It is difficult to trace them and pay them the monthly assistance,” he said. The screening kits for the camp were provided by the IMA. More such camps would be conducted at regular intervals. A joint team of food safety officials, and the police raided shops at Hosur bus stand and Sipcot and confiscated Rs. 2.5 lakh worth of banned tobacco products.Shop-keepers, who were found to be repeat offenders in the sale of banned tobacco products have been booked under the Control of Tobacco Act.
title: Special camp held
